Impact of New Presidential Election Rules in 2016                                                                   Democracy Next: Voices, Votes and Vision                              Democracy Next: Voices, Votes and Vision is presented by FairVote and NYU Dialogues. This series focuses on topics that aim to establish ways to insure fair access to participation, fair elections and fair representation in our Democratic system.                                 Event Location:   NYU Washington DC   Abramson Auditorium   1307 L Street, NW   Washington, DC 20005                                      June 27, 2013 | 4pm              Beyond Gerrymandering and Polarization                                 July 9, 2013 | 4pm              Is It Time For A Right to Vote in the Constitution? Urban Democracy Lab | An NYU Gallatin Research Lab                            Urban Democracy Lab | An NYU Gallatin Research Lab                                                                                Skip to main content                                                                                                                      Search for:                                        Menu             Menu        Skip to content        Home   About   People      Staff    Advisory Board    Visiting Scholars       Fellowship      Description    Application    Online Projects    Past Fellows       Events   Projects      Collaborations    Student Initiated       Courses      Current Courses    Upcoming Courses    Past Courses       Resources   Media   Blog                                                                           Previous           Next                                                                                              New Blog Post       | Am I Rent Stabilized? Data Visualization as Housing Activism with Chris Hendrick                                                                              New Blog Post       | The Making of New York Tenants Project: An Interview with Claudia Prat                                                                              4/21, 12:30-2pm       | SI SE PUEDE: Seven Days at PAH Barcelona (Screening and Discussion)                                                                              4/28       | Infrastructures of Resilience and Their Discontents                                                                         Our future lies in cities.   Cities concentrate our most pressing social and environmental issues while also bringing about innovative responses to these challenges and numerous forms of experimentation.   The Urban Democracy Lab promotes critical, creative, just, and sustainable forms of urbanism, through scholarship, curricular activities, public engagement, and programming.  We are especially interested in new forms of urban democracy, whether in governance, activism, self-management, or creative production.
